title: AURA: Agent for Understanding, Reasoning, and Automated Tool Use in Voice-Driven Tasks
author: Leander Melroy Maben (Carnegie Mellon University), Gayathri Ganesh Lakshmy (Carnegie Mellon University), Srijith Radhakrishnan (Carnegie Mellon University), Siddhant Arora (Carnegie Mellon University), Shinji Watanabe (Carnegie Mellon University), ...
relevance_why: The integration of reasoning and automated tool use in voice-driven tasks could enhance audio processing applications, particularly in dialogue systems which may benefit from real-world information interaction.
background: Creating a voice-driven assistant that performs multi-turn dialogues and integrates real-time tool usage, such as web searches, calendar management, and email, to complete various tasks.
contribution: AURA introduces an open-source, speech-to-speech agent capable of executing complex tasks through integrated reasoning and automated tool use, achieving high accuracy in real-world scenarios.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous speech-based systems lacked integrated tool use and extensive multi-turn dialogue capabilities, leading to limited practical applicability.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work employs a cascaded architecture for better performance, utilizing an automated reasoning model and multiple external APIs to achieve seamless interactions.

key_innovation: Combines various speech technologies into a unified system that can dynamically interact with users in natural language while performing real-world tasks.
real_world_impact: AURA has the potential to revolutionize how individuals interact with technology through voice, facilitating more effective and hands-free access to digital tools in daily tasks. The modular structure also offers room for future enhancements.
limitations: The performance metrics are based on controlled evaluations, and further real-world testing may reveal additional limitations in varied environments.

new_terms.ReAct: **ReAct** is a methodology for interleaving reasoning and action within task-oriented conversational agents, improving multi-step task execution.
new_terms.Dialog State Tracking (DST): **Dialog State Tracking** is a process where the system maintains a structured record of the dialogue state throughout an interaction, enabling effective conversation flow.
